response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age", "high", "At 18, youth is strongly associated with impulsivity and lesser maturity, increasing recidivism risk."],
    ["Race", "medium", "Minority status, particularly being Black, can correlate with systemic biases in criminal justice and socioeconomic challenges."],
    ["Criminal History", "high", "A prior arrest and conviction are robust predictors of future criminal behavior."],
    ["Education", "high", "Lack of a high school diploma or GED limits future opportunities, which is associated with higher recidivism risk."],
    ["Employment", "medium", "Holding only 2 jobs in a year suggests employment instability, contributing moderately to risk."],
    ["Substance Use", "medium", "Past marijuana use indicates some level of substance involvement, which can be linked to increased risk."],
    ["Mental Health", "medium", "Experiencing depression symptoms can affect decision-making and increase vulnerability to recidivism."],
    ["Family Background", "medium", "An urban upbringing and household structure may expose one to environmental stressors that elevate risk."],
    ["Marital Status", "low", "Never having been married and living alone is a less significant factor compared to others."],
    ["Religious Beliefs", "low", "Belief that God influences personal outcomes can offer protective community or personal coping mechanisms."],
    ["Physical Attributes", "low", "Height and weight have negligible impact on recidivism risk."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 75
}

risk_factors: At 18, youth is strongly associated with impulsivity and lesser maturity, increasing recidivism risk.
Minority status, particularly being Black, can correlate with systemic biases in criminal justice and socioeconomic challenges.
A prior arrest and conviction are robust predictors of future criminal behavior.
Lack of a high school diploma or GED limits future opportunities, which is associated with higher recidivism risk.
Holding only 2 jobs in a year suggests employment instability, contributing moderately to risk.
Past marijuana use indicates some level of substance involvement, which can be linked to increased risk.
Experiencing depression symptoms can affect decision-making and increase vulnerability to recidivism.
An urban upbringing and household structure may expose one to environmental stressors that elevate risk.
Never having been married and living alone is a less significant factor compared to others.
Belief that God influences personal outcomes can offer protective community or personal coping mechanisms.
Height and weight have negligible impact on recidivism risk.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is an 18-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 1 time and has been convicted. He is 6 feet 0 inches and weighs 145 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He does not have a high school diploma or GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held 2 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 4, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
